srclib

("source lib")



A source code analysis library, built with hackability in mind.

Use locally in your editor, create a build for your own code, or perform deep language analysis, all with the same tool, all open source.

The Challenge

Given M editors, N languages, and O features, MxNxO plugins = a virtual nightmare for any language analysis tool.

The Solution

srclib lets you publish standard formats and APIs for source analyzers and editor plugins to provide high-quality language analyzers and editor plugs, the same open-sourced analyzer that powers Sourcegraph.com.

Languages

srclib currently has language support for Ruby, Python, Node.js, and Go.

If you're a developer with a love of language, be sure to check out the other languages people are working on here.

Integrations

Provide high-quality language analyzers and editor plugs (the same open-sourced analyzer that powers Sourcegraph.com.

Install the plugin for your editor (or hack on one if we don't support it yet).

Install srclib in your editor
Run srclib on your code

Features

Use srclib for a range of actions in your code, such as jump-to-defintion, find usage examples, type inference, docu- mentation generation, and dependency resolution.

For more info, check out this screencast.
